alert.note: Alert for Caswell (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 1:46PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Caswell County through 215 PM EDT... At 145 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Prospect Hill, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Prospect Hill... Leasburg... Hightowers... and Baynes. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for north central North Carolina...and south central Virginia.
